 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָחַב‎</span> [? also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָחֹב‎</span>, so [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>BN 31</sup>; compare also Id<sup>ib. 52 f.</sup>] **verb** ==be, or grow, wide, large== (Late Hebrew in derived species (rare) and derivatives; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> Sabean in epithet of deity Fell<sup>ZMG liv (1900), 249</sup>, and proper name [[BDB#CIS|CIS]]<sup>iv, no. 1, 3 etc</sup>.; Assyrian in <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***rêbitu***</u></abbr>, ***open place***; Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎רְחַב‎</span> in derivatives ); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פִּי‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ר‎</span> [[1Sam.2.1|1Sam 2:1]], + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span> ***against*** (i.e. to devour, in figure; compare **Hiph\`il**); consecutive <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְבָבֵךְ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּפָחַד וְר‎</span> [[Isa.60.5|Isa 60:5]] ***be widened, enlarged***, relieved, and expanded with joy (compare **Hiph\`il 2**); 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְרָֽחֲבָה וְנָָֽסְבָה‎</span> [[Ezek.41.7|Ezek 41:7]] probably error, [[BDB#Co|Co]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָחְבָּהּ וְנוֺסָפָה‎</span>, Toy <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהָרֹחַב נוֺסַף‎</span>, [[BDB#Krae|Krae]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְיָָֽסְפוּ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָֽחֲבוּ‎</span> [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְ‎</span>?]. **Niph\`al** ***Participle*** as adjective <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִרְחָב‎</span> [[Isa.30.23|Isa 30:23]] ***a broad, roomy, pasture.*** **Hiph\`il** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִרְחִיב‎</span> [[Gen.26.22|Gen 26:22]]; [[Hab.2.5|Hab 2:5]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִרְחִ֑ב‎</span> [[Isa.30.33|Isa 30:33]] 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִרְחַבְתָּ‎</span> [[Ps.4.2|Ps 4:2]], etc.; ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַרְחִיב‎</span> [[Deut.12.20|Deut 12:20]] +, etc.; ***Imperative*** masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַרְחֶבֿ‎</span> [[Ps.81.11|Ps 81:11]] (compare also [[Ps.25.17|Ps 25:17]] below); feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַרְחִיבִי‎</span> [[Isa.54.2|Isa 54:2]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַרְחִבִי‎</span> [[Mic.1.16|Mic 1:16]] ***Infinitive construct*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַרְחִיב‎</span> [[Amos.1.13|Amos 1:13]] ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַרְחִיב‎</span> [[Deut.33.20|Deut 33:20]] — 

**1.** ***make large***, with accusative baldness [[Mic.1.16|Mic 1:16]] (sign of mourning), fun. pile [[Isa.30.33|Isa 30:33]] (accusative omitted; + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֶעְמִיק‎</span>); ***make wide***, accusative couch [[Isa.57.8|Isa 57:8]] (figurative). 

**2.** ***enlarge*** limit of territory (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גְּבוּל‎</span>) [[Amos.1.13|Amos 1:13]]; [[Exod.34.24|Exod 34:24]] ([[BDB#J|J]]), [[Deut.12.20|Deut 12:20]]; [[Deut.19.8|Deut 19:8]], so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גָּ֑ד‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַר‎</span> [[Deut.33.20|Deut 33:20]], compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְקוֺם אָהֳלֵךְ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַר‎</span> [[Isa.54.2|Isa 54:2]] (figurative); also absolute + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ל‎</span> person, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָנוּ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִר‎</span> [[Gen.26.22|Gen 26:22]] ([[BDB#J|J]]), and (figurative of deliverance), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִי‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַּצָּר הִר‎</span> [[Ps.4.2|Ps 4:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לוֺ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַתַּן אָדָם יַר‎</span> [[Prov.18.16|Prov 18:16]] ***a man's gift makes room for him***, gives access to patron; of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>'s ***enlarging*** the heart (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִבִּי‎</span>) [[Ps.119.32|Ps 119:32]] (compare **Qal**); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צָרוֺת לְבָבִי הִרְחִיכוּ מ‎</span> [[Ps.25.17|Ps 25:17]] read probably (with most) Imperative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַרְחֵ(י)ב ומ‎</span> ([[BDB#Bae|Bae]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִרְהִיבוּ‎</span>, ***alarm***, compare [[Song.6.5|Song 6:5]]); with accusative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צַעֲדִי‎</span> ***my step, stride*** [[Ps.18.37|Ps 18:37]] = [[2Sam.22.37|2Sam 22:37]] (i.e. givest me firm footing and vigorous step, compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צַעַד‎</span> **2**); ***enlarge*** mouth, open it wide, with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span> person ***against*** [[Isa.57.4|Isa 57:4]]; [[Ps.35.21|Ps 35:21]] (compare **Qal**); ==without== <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span>, as a young bird to receive food, figurative, [[Ps.81.11|Ps 81:11]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׁאוֺל נַפְשָׁהּ‎</span> [[Isa.5.14|Isa 5:14]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פָּֽעֲרָה פִיהָ‎</span>; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֶפֶשׁ‎</span> **5 c**), compare [[Hab.2.5|Hab 2:5]].
